intro.p: World news articles serve a specific purpose in a newspaper. These articles are written to inform the audience of events that are going on and that the audience has an interest in. News networks and journals today are extremely detailed and in-depth, covering relevant news from all over the World. CNN, one of the most accredited and widely recognized news networks has adopted different genres when responding to global news in the past compared to today. In this essay I will be looking at the various differences in genres between the year 2000, and the present, 2016.These differences in genres will be explored with regards to scope of content and language used to evaluate a situation– both between two news articles published more than a decade and a half apart. I will also be discussing the uptakes between the two genres and how the genres interact with one another given the difference in the years published.

body.bodyPara: As a genre, news websites/ journals perform a unique task which is to inform the public of current events that occur in the World around them.Every news article from CNN (or any other news source, for that matter) involves at least 1 scene and situation. Each CNN article contains at least one scene as news is constantly packed with interactions between different entities. For example, currently, the majority of articles and the scenes developed within them involve politics as there is an election between two presidential candidates coming up.The situations built within those scenes involve the actions of the participants. With regard to the example given before, the situations built upon today’s political scene (in news journals) reflect the actions of the presidential candidates.The rest of this genre analysis will analyze the differences in scenes and situations between CNN articles published online in 2000 and in 2016 with particular focus on language and scope of content to ultimately determine the changes in value of news writers and journalists

Looking at the CNN page above from August 15, 2000, we can spot several articles surrounding the main article in the center, similar to how one could imagine modern-day online news articles to look like. However, the one contrasting aspect about the genre in the news in 2000 (above picture) is that the principle news is US news and not foreign news. Although regional news may also be noteworthy, it is debatable whether “Clinton says Democrats hold keys to future”, an article discussing Bill Clinton’s praise for the Democratic Party, is more important that the reunion of families from North and South Korea who have been estranged for decades(CNN, 09/15/00) (which is seen in the “In Other News” section). CNN is “a 24-hour global multi-platform network”, which means that although it is an American news network, it is responsible for covering substantial global news. The fact that World news is located in the “In Other News” section speaks a fair amount about the values of the readers of news articles in the 2000s. It implies that the target audience who read CNN news articles in the 2000s were Americans– not global readers. The content of news from the 2000s suggests that American audiences at the time were interested in scenes and the situations built within those scenes for articles regarding the United States.Specifically, there is more mention of political news in newspapers in the 2000s. This means that news articles particularly valued political agendas and scenes and situations regarding politicians.I fixed your figure elements (the url for the image should be the attribute value for the @url attribute)

CNN adopts a contrasting view on online news articles, as seen in the photo above (taken on October 6th, 2016). The breaking news is regarding Hurricane Matthew which is responsible for major damage in much of the North America region. “Matthew slams Haiti with 145-mph winds and heavy rain” is a global headline which suggests that the breaking news, the news which is the most essential for readers to be aware of, is in fact global and isn’t focused on America. This suggests a shift in genre and values to a global scope rather than focusing purely on news from the United States, which may not be as important. Furthermore, there seems to be restructure in the layout of the CNN website where “Top News” now consists of a mix of local and global news. CNN shifted their focus to global scenes which are more essential to audiences in the modern day.

There are some uptakes that help intertwine the changes in genre from American-focused news articles in 2000 to global news articles in 2016.One example of uptake which has persisted over the years is the use of photos. In 2000, photos of various scenes and the situations within them are shown in almost every news article. As shown in the CNN website in 2016, photos are still very useful as an uptake to help enhance articles. Of course, the photos in the modern day are more detailed and specific compared to those in 2000. Videos are more newly developed uptakes which, in a way, marked the transition from local to global news. Videos are a more expressive form of communication which can replace words. Videos tend to attract more audiences, which is why almost every news article in CNN today has at least one video included.

concl.p: News articles on CNN, one of the leading news networks in America, have shifted their genre focus from 2000 to 2016 from reporting more local-based news to reporting breaking news from all over the world. CNN now reports on various global scenes and develops on their respective situations and the parties which are involved in those situations. As for the website itself, it has adopted a more comprehensive layout which puts local news into focus just as much as it does global news. CNN also integrates more videos into their news articles for viewers who choose not wish to read the entire article.

report.p: Good essay in general. From what I understood, the essay focuses on two different genres relating to news articles, one focused in the past and one on the present. In my opinion, I think you should make your thesis statement more detailed to mention the complete overview of what you are going to write. Also, mentioning the uptakes that will be discussed might also help with guiding your essay in a more flow-like manner. The essay seems to be going in the direction of solving the prompt mentioned during class. However, stating the main argument in a clearer way would be more effective because it is slightly difficult to identify it. One thing you can improve on is mentioning what the genre actually is to help the people who are reading it for the first time understand what the essay is about. The body paragraphs are very detailed and well organized. I think you should also mention the genre itself in the introduction as it helps the reader know what the main idea of the essay is. I liked the examples you used in the body paragraphs, they were very descriptive. However, I think you should organize the sentences a bit differently, because they seem to go from topic to topic with a slightly hard to follow flow. Overall I liked the topic of the essay and the ideas you presented. Would appreciate it if you looked over my review.
